SEARCH
Package src.components

Class Field

java.lang.Object
src.components.Component
src.components.Field
public class Field extends Component
The Field will be placed in the Grid and contains a value from 0-9, where 9 indicates a Minefield and the other numbers indicate the number of Mines around the Field. A Field has 1 of 3 possible states: "Unknown", "Reveiled" and "Flagged". A "Reveiled" Field can no longer be interacted with and a "Flagged" Field can't be reveiled. The Color of the field is dependent from it's state. A Reveiled Field uses it's value as Index to get it's Color from the StaticValues.COLORS. Each Field stores its Location in the Grid as matrixLoction and can store a reference to all adjacent Fields. This reference can later be used for area effects.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Field

      public Field(int width, int height, int x, int y)
      Takes width, height, x and y coordinates to create a Field Object. Field Objects are used in a Grid to create a Minefield.
      Parameters:
      width - width of the Field
      height - height of the Field
      x - x coordinate of the Field on the canvas
      y - y coordinate of the Field on the canvas

  • Method Details

      Returns the FieldState of the Field.
      Returns:
      FieldState of the Field

    • setMatrixLocation

      public void setMatrixLocation(int x, int y)
      Takes an x and y coordinate to be stored in this Objects matrixLocation variable.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate to be stored in this Objects matrixLocation variable
      y - y coordinate to be stored in this Objects matrixLocation variable

    • getMatrixLocation

      public Point getMatrixLocation()
      Returns a Point Object that contains an x and y value representing the location inside the Grid matrix.
      Returns:
      x and y location inside the Grid matrix

    • setValue

      public void setValue(int value)
      Takes an int value (between 0-9) to store in this Objects value variable. Where 0-8 represent the amount of Mines around the Field, 9 indicates, that the Field itsself is a Mine.
      Parameters:
      value - value to store in this Objects value variable

    • setFlagSounds

      public void setFlagSounds(Clip flag, Clip unflag)
      Takes two sound Objects to set for the flag and unflag actions.
      Parameters:
      flag - sound for the flag action
      unflag - sound for the unflag action

    • getValue

      public int getValue()
      Returns the value of this Field.
      Returns:
      value of this Field

    • setAdjacentFields

      public void setAdjacentFields(List<Field> adjacentFields)
      Takes a List of Fields to store in the adjacentFields List. These Fields can be used for actions that concern the other Fields around this Field Object.
      Parameters:
      adjacentFields - List of all adjacent Fields

    • getAdjacentFields

      public List<Field> getAdjacentFields()
      Retunrns adjacentFields to use for actions that concern the other Fields around this Field Object.
      Returns:
      all adjacent Fields

    • action

      public void action(Point mouseLocation)
      Takes a mouse location and checks, if it collides with the Field. If it collides, the reveilAction of the Field wil be triggered.
      Parameters:
      mouseLocation - current location of the mouse

    • reveil

      public void reveil()
      Changes the State of the Field to "Reveiled" and sets the corresponding Color.

    • show

      public void show()
      Reveils the value and Color of the Field without changing it's FieldState.

    • conceal

      public void conceal()
      Sets the FieldState to UNKNOWN and hides it's value and Color.

    • reveilAction

      public void reveilAction()
      Action to be triggred, when a Field is reveiled. If a mine is reveiled, the Game ends. If a field with value 0 is reveiled, all adjacent Fields are reveiled as well. All 0 Fields reveiled additionally will also reveil their adjacent Fields.

    • flagAction

      public void flagAction(Point mouseLocation)
      Action to be triggered, when a Field is flagged. The Fieldstate of a Unkwnown Field will be changed to Flagged and vice versa.
      Parameters:
      mouseLocation - current location of the mouse
